com.jayway.changeless.records
Class Records

java.lang.Object
  com.jayway.changeless.records.Records

public final class Records
extends Object

An utility class for working with Record instances.

Below is an example of what is possible. 

 interface Planet extends Record {
   String name();
   Planet name(String name);
   double mass();
   Planet mass(double mass);
 }
 
 RecordBuilder pb = Records.builder(Planet.class);
 Planet earth   = pb.create().name("Earth").mass(1.00);
 Planet jupiter = pb.create().name("Jupiter").mass(11.209);
 Planet neptune = pb.create().name("Neptune").mass(3.883);
                
 Sequence<Planet> planets = Sequences.of(earth, jupiter, neptune);
 Planet largestMass = planets.reduce(new Fn2<Planet, Planet, Planet>() {
   public Planet apply(Planet result, Planet planet) {
     return Comparables.greaterThan(planet.mass(), result.mass()) 
                       ? planet : result;
   }
 });
 
 assertEquals("Planet name", "Jupiter", largestMass.name());

Method Detail

of

public static <T extends Record> T of(Class<T> clazz)

Create a new Record of the given type.

See Record for more information about records.

Note that if you are going to create many instances of the same record type you should use the builder(Class) method instead as it will be much faster.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the record to create.
Parameters:
clazz - the class of the record to create.
Returns:
the created record.
Throws:
RecordValidationException - if the given class is not a valid Record interface. see Record for more information.

builder

public static <T extends Record> RecordBuilder<T> builder(Class<T> clazz)
Creates a new RecordBuilder capable of creating record instances of type T.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the record that the build should be capable of building.
Parameters:
clazz - the class of the record to create.
Returns:
a new RecordBuilder capable of creating record instances of type T.
